Title.evidence: Continuous EEG Monitoring in Neonates with Congenital Heart Disease: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Participants.evidence: Infants with CHD who underwent surgery by 44 weeks gestational age and had cEEG monitoring were included.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was neurodevelopmental scores on the Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development (BSID-III) at 12–24 months.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 34 patients were included

Result_Outcome.evidence: Longer cross-clamp time was associated with poor language composite scores (p = 0.036).
